It is a small, evergreen fern that typically grows in rocky, alpine environments. The plant features delicate, pinnate leaves that are covered in a fine, whitish coating, which helps reduce water loss in its harsh habitat. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, Hemionitis incarum is considered a vulnerable species.
